author: Centurion75

review: I have a few Roku devices at home but was looking for something that didn't need a "channel" to work.  Chromecast is awesome.  I didn't quite get it until I saw on revision3 techzilla and it is liberating to stream video on the net from your laptop to your tv via the chromecast hdmi connection.  I tend to like to watch tv in hand and with Chromecast you can still surf other web pages as it streams and the quality is top notch all without wires.  (Keep in mind you will need a high speed connection).  Anyway I liked this so much I ditched my roku's and replaced another 2 with Chromecast.  Great product period.

review: It's okay.  It's not as good as the Roku box, but the compact format is very attractive.  I think it will be better once more apps are available for it. But right now the chromecasting apps are extremely limited.If netflix is all you need, I would imagine that this would be perfect.

author: Connie

review: I love my chromecast. At first I was a little disappointed in the app support for it, but this has been steadily increasing. The one major thing it still doesn't support is amazon video streaming. This seems a little short sighted of amazon even if they are supposedly releasing a streaming device soon they can still get the revenue from chromecast owners. I wish this device also had a 5ghz wifi mode as I have run into issues a couple times with quality when streaming to it over 2.4ghz. I love that I can cast web tabs but this feature is still rather buggy. Otherwise I primarily stream netflix, hbo go, and plex to this device and they all work really well.
author: Trey Kyle
